page.title: 15WORK IN THE HORLEY AREA
page.content: Whilst the national unemployment figure stands at an average of 13.3% with some northern and rural areas considerably higher, that in Horley is well below average at only 5.3%, this figure being maintained during the last two years. Several factors have led to this advantage. The location of Horley on a main railway line only 30 miles from London, with the use of Gatwick Station, serving the airport, has led to its development as a commuter town, whilst the rapid development of Gatwick has provided employment to thousands of people both at the airport and in work related, providing the services and amenities of an ever expanding community. Few people living in the Horley are without at least one member of their family whose work has some connection with Gatwick and its services.
